name: Test Protocol Full
summary: This structured test automatically prompts the user through a sequence of steps. A tweet sound indicates it is time for the user to move to the next rotational angle. This sequence repeats until the round is complete. An audible train sound indicates that the round is over. Users can then submit the results. This sequence continues through all distances making up the test.

name: Test Protocol Mid
summary: This structured test automatically prompts the user through a sequence of steps. A tweet sound indicates it is time for the user to move to the next rotational angle. This sequence repeats until the round is complete. An audible train sound indicates that the round is over. Users can then submit the results. This sequence continues through all distances making up the test.

name: Test Protocol Short
summary: This structured test automatically prompts the user through a sequence of steps. A tweet sound indicates it is time for the user to move to the next rotational angle. This sequence repeats until the round is complete. An audible train sound indicates that the round is over. Users can then submit the results. This sequence continues through all distances making up the test.

name: General
summary: This test option allows users to enter their range (distance from a beacon), as well as their angle from the beacon. After each run, users can choose to send the data collected for analysis, or to rerun the test.

name: H0
summary: Testers are asked to remain 10 ft. or more apart for 4 minutes. The tests are conducted in a situational state chosen by the Testers such as phones in back pockets with one Tester sitting and the other walking about. The Tests may be conducted inside or outside so long as safe distancing protocols are maintained.

name: H1
summary: Testers stay within 6 ft. of each other for 4 minutes. The tests are conducted in a situational state chosen by the Testers such as phones in back pockets with one Tester sitting and the other walking about. The Tests may be conducted inside or outside so long as safe distancing protocols are maintained.
